UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Alcam Medical Orthotics and Prosthetics, is one of the leading clinical authorities in the provision of rehabilitative solutions, including being one of the largest owners and operator of orthotic and prosthetic clinics in Southern California.
Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.
Duties include, but may not be limited to:
Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Come join our team, and enjoy making a difference to our little ones as we help create the future!

Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Alcam Medical Orthotics and Prosthetics, is one of the leading clinical authorities in the provision of rehabilitative solutions, including being one of the largest owners and operator of orthotic and prosthetic clinics in Southern California.
Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.
Duties include, but may not be limited to:
Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis

Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Job Title: CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO) AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO) UVA Health System
Job Description:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Alcam Medical Orthotics and Prosthetics, is one of the leading clinical authorities in the provision of rehabilitative solutions, including being one of the largest owners and operator of orthotic and prosthetic clinics in Southern California.
Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.
Duties include, but may not be limited to:
Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Come join our team, and enjoy making a difference to our little ones as we help create the future!

Job Type: Full-time

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Job Title: Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO, CP, Board Eligible)- Relocation Assistance!
Job Description:
Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:
We are looking for a Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist to enhance our collaborative team and support our growing prosthetic referral sources. This individual will need to have or obtain a license as a Prosthetist in Illinois. Our patient load consist of a large majority lower extremity but we see a solid mix of upper extremity patients as well. We work with high-end prosthetic devices or your choice of components that work best with our patients' needs. We support several hospital systems in the area and have a strong post-op program.

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Job Title: CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO) AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO) UVA Health System
Job Description:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Alcam Medical Orthotics and Prosthetics, is one of the leading clinical authorities in the provision of rehabilitative solutions, including being one of the largest owners and operator of orthotic and prosthetic clinics in Southern California.
Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.
Duties include, but may not be limited to:
Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Job Title: Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO, CP, Board Eligible)- Relocation Assistance!
Job Description:
Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:
We are looking for a Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist to enhance our collaborative team and support our growing prosthetic referral sources. This individual will need to have or obtain a license as a Prosthetist in Illinois. Our patient load consist of a large majority lower extremity but we see a solid mix of upper extremity patients as well. We work with high-end prosthetic devices or your choice of components that work best with our patients' needs. We support several hospital systems in the area and have a strong post-op program.

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.

Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.

UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. Job Title: CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO) AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO) UVA Health System
Job Description:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Alcam Medical Orthotics and Prosthetics, is one of the leading clinical authorities in the provision of rehabilitative solutions, including being one of the largest owners and operator of orthotic and prosthetic clinics in Southern California.
Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.
Duties include, but may not be limited to:
Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

We are very involved in our community and active in improving policies and procedures in our field. We are a pediatric based clinic, with a heavy emphasis on cranial remolding helmets and pediatric orthotics. We are expanding into scoliosis care, as well as upper extremity prosthetics and lower extremity prosthetics. Must be able to work well as a team, must be able to work independently as well. Come join our team, and enjoy making a difference to our little ones as we help create the future!

Job Type: Full-time

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Job Title: Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO, CP, Board Eligible)- Relocation Assistance!
Job Description:
Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:
We are looking for a Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist to enhance our collaborative team and support our growing prosthetic referral sources. This individual will need to have or obtain a license as a Prosthetist in Illinois. Our patient load consist of a large majority lower extremity but we see a solid mix of upper extremity patients as well. We work with high-end prosthetic devices or your choice of components that work best with our patients' needs. We support several hospital systems in the area and have a strong post-op program.

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.

Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Job Description:
Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:
We are looking for a Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist to enhance our collaborative team and support our growing prosthetic referral sources. This individual will need to have or obtain a license as a Prosthetist in Illinois. Our patient load consist of a large majority lower extremity but we see a solid mix of upper extremity patients as well. We work with high-end prosthetic devices or your choice of components that work best with our patients' needs. We support several hospital systems in the area and have a strong post-op program.

Job Description:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Alcam Medical Orthotics and Prosthetics, is one of the leading clinical authorities in the provision of rehabilitative solutions, including being one of the largest owners and operator of orthotic and prosthetic clinics in Southern California.
Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.

Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Job Title: CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO) AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO) UVA Health System
Job Description:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.

Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:
We are looking for a Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist to enhance our collaborative team and support our growing prosthetic referral sources. This individual will need to have or obtain a license as a Prosthetist in Illinois. Our patient load consist of a large majority lower extremity but we see a solid mix of upper extremity patients as well. We work with high-end prosthetic devices or your choice of components that work best with our patients' needs. We support several hospital systems in the area and have a strong post-op program.

A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.
Duties include, but may not be limited to:
Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Become an integral part of an extremely competent clinical team that strives for a unique and high quality experience for each and every patient.
Certified Orthotist, Prosthetist
A certified orthotist and/or prosthetist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Documentation by the orthotist and/or prosthetist is part of the patient’s medical record and assists with establishing medical necessity for orthotic and/or prosthetic care. Orthotic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of orthoses to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition. This also includes the provision of partial foot prostheses for transmetatarsal and distal amputations. Prosthetic care includes patient evaluation and the design, fabrication, fitting, modification, maintenance and repair of prostheses to restore physiological function and/or cosmesis. Orthotic and/or prosthetic care does not include independent provision of invasive procedures, including, but not limited to, injections and initial application or replacement of skull pins. The orthotist and/or prosthetist certified and bound by the Code of Professional Responsibility which is enforced by a Professional Discipline program. The certified orthotist/ prosthetist is obligated to support and conform to professional responsibilities that promote and assure the overall welfare of the patient and the integrity of the profession. The time limited certification expires without compliance with requirements of the Recertification program. The practice of a certified orthotist and/or prosthetist includes, but is not limited to:

All candidates should possess current certification by the American Board for Certification (ABC) in Prosthetics and Orthotics or be board-eligible.
Major duties include, but are not limited to:
Performing comprehensive assessments of patients to obtain an understanding of the patients’ prosthetic/orthotic needs and goals in order to design the most appropriate prosthetic/orthotic devices.
Creating a comprehensive prosthetic/orthotic treatment plan to meet the needs and goals of the patient in collaboration with the ordering physician(s).
Performing all of the necessary procedures to create, fit, manufacture, test, and deliver the appropriate prosthetic/orthotic.
Providing continuing patient care and periodic evaluation to assure/maintain/document optimal fit and function of the prosthesis/orthosis
Company Name: A Step Ahead Prosthetics and Orthotics

Why Us?:
With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With nearly 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.
Could This Be For You?:
We are looking for a Prosthetist or Prosthetist Orthotist to enhance our collaborative team and support our growing prosthetic referral sources. This individual will need to have or obtain a license as a Prosthetist in Illinois. Our patient load consist of a large majority lower extremity but we see a solid mix of upper extremity patients as well. We work with high-end prosthetic devices or your choice of components that work best with our patients' needs. We support several hospital systems in the area and have a strong post-op program.

UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HEALTH PHYSICIANS GROUP
CERTIFIED PROSTHETIST ORTHOTIST (CPO)
AND CERTIFIED ORTHOTIST (CO)
The Prosthetics and Orthotics Division in the University of Virginia's School of Medicine seeks a Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO) and a Certified Orthotist (CO) to consult, provide, and fabricate orthotic and prosthetic devices for adults and children with musculoskeletal impairments throughout Central Virginia. The successful candidates will be responsible for managing comprehensive orthotic and/or prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, and follow-up care and practice management. Candidates for both positions should have a bachelor's degree in Orthotics and Prosthetics from an accredited program and a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency program.

We are a 40 year old practice with offices in Chattanooga Tennessee and in Dalton Georgia seeking an ABC Certified Orthotist-Prosthetist to join our Team.
We are excited by the opportunities and challenges presented to us every day and we enjoy sharing and contributing to the clinical response as a Team effort. We are seeking to add another Practitioner who shares our passion.
If you are someone who has a love for the industry and for the people we serve, we would be interested in speaking with you.
Salary is based upon experience. Benefits include company paid health insurance, dental, vision, disability, life insurance and paid time off.
Job Type: Full-time

Position Summary
The Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist is specifically trained and educated to independently provide or supervise the provision of comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
Orthotics combines a unique blend of clinical and technical skills. Certified Prosthetist/Orthotist evaluate patients and custom design, fabricate and fit orthoses. They work with other members of rehabilitation teams and help change a patient's life.
The clinical skills and technical knowledge required to accomplish orthotic tasks are extensive, complex, and sophisticated. Proper care requires not only extensive training in the field, but also a comprehensive understanding of anatomy, physiology, biomechanics and kinesiology – in short, how the body's components operate and interrelate.

Alcam Medical Orthotics and Prosthetics, is one of the leading clinical authorities in the provision of rehabilitative solutions, including being one of the largest owners and operator of orthotic and prosthetic clinics in Southern California.
Whether directly or indirectly, every individual across every department at Alcam is helping to improve the lives of our patients and customers. We know that the “possible” lives inside each of us, waiting to be unleashed. At every touch point across all our business, we are keeping lives in motion, breaking down barriers, taking dreams further.

Performs a comprehensive assessment of the patient to obtain an understanding of the patients' orthotic/prosthetic needs.

Come join our team, and enjoy making a difference to our little ones as we help create the future!
